title: Shouldn't champions with dashes/blinks have less movement speed than those without?
body:
We have champions like {{champion:96}} {{champion:37}} {{champion:143}} {{champion:22}}  that have no gapclosers and are very squishy, while having the lowest tier of base movement speed (325).

Then there are champions like {{champion:238}} {{champion:64}}  who have multiple ways to close gaps on others. You could argue that once their abilities are on cooldown they're left vulnerable right? Well {{champion:64}}  has 350 base movement speed compared to{{champion:96}}  325, so even if he somehow didn't get to you with two dashes, he'll **still** be able to outrun you.

replies.body:
I think it depends on each case.  A champion whose identity is mobility should have high ms and dashes.  A champion whose weakness is lack of mobility should have low ms and no dashes. 

I think some cases are ridiculous though.  Hecarim is supposed to be incredibly mobile without dashes so one would Logically think he'd have the highest base ms in the game and yet he's 345, close but not there.  Zed has so many other identities I think 350ms is overkill and he should have 340 or something. 

Also in general melee champions have higher base ms than ranged champions.  Which makes sense gameplay wise I guess,  but Logically a lithe Archer or mage should be able to outrun a heavily armoured soldier or a bulky minotaur...

Well, for the low movement speed examples you have given, Ashe has a permanent slow. If she also had a high move speed, she would be awful to deal with. Zyra has a fairly long range and amazing disengage. I think the idea behind her low movement speed is to reward her enemy if they can get past her spells. Sona has a fairly unhealthy play pattern in lane - high movement speed would exacerbate this. She also does have a powerful speed boost. Kog'maw has arguably the highest late game damage in the game along with a very high range. If he had any more safety he would be far too strong.

For the high movement speed champions... I am in two minds about them. Yes, they have two gapclosers, so on one hand it seems unfair. On the other hand, a small amount of movement speed is more useful in dodging and rotating than in chasing (particularly with the prevalence of flash). If you are so out of position that this movement makes a big difference to your escape after they have used their gaplosers, you probably deserve to die. 
Overall, given that Zed and Lee Sin are all about making plays across the map, they really need the movement speed.

In answer to the poll, no. There is a lot more to consider when deciding movement speed than just the mobility in a champion's kit.

Movespeed should be based on a number of things.  

1) Ranged or Melee - Melee's should have faster Movement Speed since Ranged already has the advantage of, well, being ranged...  

2) Overall Mobility Potential - Someone like Lee Sin who has high Mobility should have less Movement Speed then someone like Mordekaiser who has no Mobility.  

3) Amount and Type of CC - Someone like Ashe with a Permaslow AA, Wide Cone Slow, and a Mass Stun shouldn't have a lot of Movement Speed, someone like Darius who only has his short range pull should have a higher base Movement Speed.  

4) Tankiness and Damage - Tanks should be big lumbering balls of resistances walking into a fight and laying down some tanks-version-of-whoopass, Assassins should be quick and agile going in and out of fights.  

Thats my opinion on Movement Speed.

I think this thread isn't necessarily about arguing why move speed varies per champ, but deep down it's about how some champs have stats they shouldn't.

Lee Sin is just too mobile. Period. I think Hecarim is also too mobile. Even if you see his gank coming a mile away, you usually can't even outrun him. The only counterplay is to farm under your tower which is just ridiculous. No one champ should make you afraid to leave the range of your tower just because they are highly mobile and can catch you out even when you spot them with wards. At least Lee Sin has outplay potential by dodging his Q... There are champs you can't outrun and I honestly think it's kind of dumb.

I think some champions can be extremely fast and still remain healthy. Udyr I think is probably a little too fast still, given that a movement speed Janna can't outrun him without knock-ups etc if he has flash up. I definitely feel Lee Sin needs his speed nerfed; he has a gap closer he needs to land that's on a short cooldown. He needs to be punished more for missing it. If he starts at medium range to you and misses one, he should get a maximum of one more chance before you're past max range, and that's only if you've got comparable boots.

Hecarim... Now I see hecarim as the exception, because Hecarim's built around his mobility being crucial to his kit. He's the headless horseman who will run you down no matter where you go. BUT a strong slow or some hard CC and he's boned, and while he moves fast, his ultimate gap closer doesn't have a huge range, or especially low cooldown, and he can be CC'd before he reaches you; he's not going to jump you out of NOWHERE unless you have no vision or flashes a wall, rather than someone like Lee, where you just see a coconut cocktail flying at you before you get kicked in the face.

In my opinion, this is how movement speed should be organized:

Melee + No Mobility: Highest Base Movement Speed
Melee + Minor Mobility: High Base Movement Speed
Ranged + No Mobility: Above Average Base Movement Speed
Melee + Mobility: Average Base Movement Speed
Ranged + Minor Mobility: Average Base Movement Speed
Melee + Super Mobility: Below Average Base Movement Speed
Ranged + Mobility: Below Average Base Movement Speed
Ranged + Super Mobility: Low Base Movement Speed

Melee and Ranged champions would be treated as if they were ranged plus 5 more base movement speed.

Melee with high mobility = okay. It's an ADC with high mobility that's not okay.
